New-York Historical Society Collection of Photographic Slides Collection
New-York Historical Society Collection of Photographic Slides Collection

This collection is a format-based collection for small accessions of slides. It includes photographic slides of New York City in the 1960s and 1970s taken by amateur photographers Herbert Sendecki and Ray H. Billings.

This collection is a format-based collection for small accessions of slides. It includes photographic slides of New York City in the 1960s and 1970s taken by amateur photographers Herbert Sendecki and Ray H. Billings.

This is a format-based collection for small accessions of slides. The collection consists of photographic slides taken by amateur photographers Herbert Sendecki and Ray H. Billings. The slides span the period from 1960 to 1979 and have been organized by photographer.
Sendecki Slides includes all of the photographic slides taken by Herbert Sendecki, which depict various New York City neighborhoods, street scenes, and buildings in 1963 and 1964.

Billings Slides includes interior shots of a New York City police department radio room from 1972, views of the 1964 World's Fair and other New York City sites, and views of Lake George and other unidentified locations outside New York City.
Gift of Herbert Sendecki, 2008; gift of Raynette Billings Noles, 2009.
